If your blood pressure is 20 points above your normal, and you have swelling of hands, feet and/or face, and you have protein in your urine,  that would give a diagnosis of pre-eclampsia. Other symptoms to watch out for are severe headaches, and blurred vision. If you believe you may have pre-eclampsia, drop in at your OB office, and ask for a urine check, and a blood pressure check. This will tell them quickly if there is a problem. You do not need to wait for your next appt. to do this, nor would it be a good idea to wait if you have these symptoms.As far as the asthma-This may sound wierd, but try eating very small meals. When you get to the 3rd trimester, there is less room for everything, including your lungs. When you eat a big meal, it crowds out your breathing space. Also, maybe you should ask your Dr. for a nebulizer for the albuterol for the rest of your pg. This will deliver it more slowly, and give your lungs more opportunity to respond to it than if you just take the two puffs. Your Dr. can also prescribe a peak flow meter, and a pulse oximeter to help you monitor your breathing. You can then record these readings, and go over it with your Dr. at each visit. This is much more concrete for your Dr. than "I can't breathe".
